decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly and efficiently dump its entire library into the graveyard, utilizing various mana accelerators to cast a series of low-cost spells that facilitate this goal. By leveraging multiple ways to generate mana and fast-paced graveyard interactions, the primary objective is to win the game by either decking out the opponent with Thassa's Oracle, or by using Dread Return to reanimate key creatures like Balustrade Spy to combo off and achieve victory in one explosive turn.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively search for and play lands that provide additional value or disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Elvish Reclaimer, the deck can quickly assemble powerful combinations such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a game-ending 20/20 flying indestructible creature. Cards like Gaddock Teeg and Swords to Plowshares provide disruption and removal, while Sylvan Library and Green Sun's Zenith offer card advantage and flexibility in finding key creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive elements.

The deck focuses on using aggressive Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith to ramp into powerful threats like Reality Smasher and Sire of Seven Deaths. The deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control with efficient creatures and disruptive spells, ultimately winning the game through creature combat and resource denial.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board with a mix of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Phelia and Quantum Riddler. It utilizes Stoneforge Mystic to tutor up equipment such as Batterskull and Meteor Sword to further control the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Recruiter of the Guard can search for specific creatures. The deck also includes utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game through efficient use of resources and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void to lock down opponent's spells, and cards like Thought-Knot Seer to strip important cards from their hand, the deck aims to be aggressive and proactive in its strategy. With a mix of creatures and disruptive spells, the Eldrazi Aggro deck looks to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Ninja creatures, such as Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ingenious Infiltrator, to quickly deal damage to the opponent while also gaining card advantage. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board and protect its own creatures. The mix of low-cost creatures, counter spells, and removal allows for a fast-paced aggressive strategy that aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can build up their own game plan.

This deck aims to quickly combo off and win the game by milling the entire library, then using Thassa's Oracle to win the game before drawing an empty deck. The main strategy involves using various fast mana sources and discard spells to set up the combo as quickly as possible, while also having protection in the form of Pact of Negation. The combo pieces include Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire library, along with Narcomoeba and a reanimation spell like Dread Return to finish the game with Thassa's Oracle.

This deck focuses on using a mix of control elements and equipment to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up a strong board presence. Stoneforge Mystic allows for efficient equipment tutoring, while cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler provide card advantage and disruption. The inclusion of Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd adds a unique twist to the control archetype, offering protection and resilience to threats. By combining powerful control spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares with efficient creatures and equipment, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

This Bant Control Legacy deck focuses on playing a variety of control spells and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy while protecting its own game plan. The deck uses powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats, along with counter spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. It also utilizes card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as recursion with Life from the Loam. Key threats in the deck include Murktide Regent and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides further card advantage. The deck also includes lands like Wasteland and Karakas to further control the battlefield.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and deal direct damage using cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory. The deck includes cards like Swords to Plowshares and Goblin Bombardment for removal and additional damage. Static Prison helps control the opponent's board, while the land base includes fetch lands for consistency and utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland for disruption. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing various creatures and equipment to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure on the board. It aims to control the game through interactions such as removal spells, flickering creatures, and bouncing opponent's permanents. The deck also utilizes the synergy between Recruiter of the Guard and toolbox creatures to adapt to different situations. With its mana denial strategy using Wasteland and Karakas, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's progression while maintaining a strong presence on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on aggressively deploying Death's Shadow along with other efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Cecil, Dark Knight, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with a suite of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Force of Will. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help with card selection and manipulation. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, Wasteland and Undercity Sewers can disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents while deploying threats quickly to apply pressure. It utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board while using tempo plays such as Daze and Force of Will to protect its own game plan. The deck also includes strong threats like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower to close out games quickly. It aims to outpace opponents by efficiently using its mana base and card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to stay ahead in the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the opponent's resources and protect its own threats. It also incorporates efficient removal like Fatal Push to maintain tempo advantage. The creatures in the deck, such as Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf, are powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's strategy and ensure consistency in casting its spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Mystic Forge combo deck is to generate mana quickly through artifacts like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal, then use Mystic Forge to continuously cast spells from the top of the library. Utilizing cards like The One Ring and Urza's Saga to create a powerful board presence, while also using Karn, the Great Creator and Disruptor Flute to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to create a dominating board state and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of brute force and disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Murktide Regent, and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat while also manipulating the top of the deck with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes disruptive lands like Wasteland. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo and aggression to quickly close out games.
